solution_line_template: The last {num_last_three_students} students had an average completion time of {avg_time_last_three} seconds so the sum of their completion times was {num_last_three_students}*{avg_time_last_three} = <<{num_last_three_students}*{avg_time_last_three}={sum_time_last_three}>>{sum_time_last_three} seconds

All {total_students} students (now including the student who came first) had an average completion time of {avg_time_all_four} seconds, meaning the sum of their completion times is {total_students}*{avg_time_all_four} = <<{total_students}*{avg_time_all_four}={sum_time_all_four}>>{sum_time_all_four} seconds
The student who came first spent {sum_time_all_four}-{sum_time_last_three} = <<{sum_time_all_four}-{sum_time_last_three}={first_student_time}>>{first_student_time} seconds in the race
